item.title: LibrExam (the birth of)
item.description: Mock tests are a global phenomenon. Every student — from American AP Physics 2 bros to Chinese Gaokao tryhards to Indian JEE Advanced sweats — takes them. And they usually cost a pretty penny. Breaking Bad the mock examinations cartel. Not anymore. Goodbye legacy, propeitary, limited-in-scope-and-content test taking software. Welcome LibrExam. Welcome its AGPL-3 License (I am looking at you, Microsoft*). The fundamental idea behind LibrExam is that it’s kind of decentralised.
